commit message:
Fix some issues with the index terms

Drop some French words which were left over.

Reported-by: Christian T. Steigies <cts@debian.org>

Small fixups and enhancements concerning the Xorg section

Reported-by: Cyril Brulebois <kibi@debian.org>

Remove the part about 6bone.

6bone is dead since a long time now.  Although there are a few IPv6-only
backbones in a world, most of them are dual-stack and nobody refers to them as
6bone.  Basically it's the IPv6 DFZ (default free zone), but that's just
confusing to the reader.

Use the well-known IPv6 documentation prefix.

3ffe::/16 does not exist anymore.  2001:db8::/32 is the well-known
documentation prefix that should be used in examples for IPv6 addressing.

IPv6 and firewalls: improve the paragraph.

The current paragraph is factually wrong.  It talks about native IPv6 requiring
IP protocol number 41.  No, it does not require IPv4 protocol number 41, it
even has its own ethertype.  Tunneled IPv6 needs proto41 to be opened.  (And
it doesn't work behind NAT.)  Also state that IPv6 can be firewalled just like
IPv4.
First commit to test, sorry for the incovenience
Acknowledge the fact that librement.sty is the work of Jean-Côme and Sébastien

/etc/debian_version says '<codename>/sid' and not 'testing/unstable'

'testing/unstable' was last used during etch's development. Since then
base-files has been using '<codename>/sid'.

Replace GAIM by AIM

The instant messaging network is AIM. GAIM is a miscapitalization of
Gaim, a multi-protocol instant messaging client that was renamed to
Pidgin five years ago.

Signed-off-by: Raphaël Hertzog <hertzog@debian.org>

KDE's kwm was renamed to kwin some time ago
